titlestmt.subtitle: A Finding Aid to the Collection in the Library of Congress
titlestmt.author: Prepared by Manuscript Division Staff

profiledesc.creation:
Finding aid encoded by Library of Congress Manuscript Division,
2009

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Army officer. Correspondence, diaries, writings, reports, military documents, photographs, printed matter, scrapbooks, and miscellaneous material relating mainly to Allen's military career.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically therein.

controlaccess.head: People
controlaccess.persname: Allen, Henry T. (Henry Tureman), 1859-1930. My Rhineland journal. 1923.

controlaccess.head: Organizations
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Army--History--Punitive Expedition into Mexico, 1916.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The papers of Henry T. Allen were given to the Library of Congress by his son, Henry T. Allen, Jr., in 1956.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The Henry T. Allen Papers were processed in 1957 and revised and expanded in 2005. The finding aid was revised in 2009.

otherfindaid.head: Additional Guides
otherfindaid.p: A note about the Henry T. Allen Papers appeared in the Library's Information Bulletin, vol. 16, no. 2 (14 Jan. 1957), and the material was described in the Library of Congress Quarterly Journal of Current Acquisitions, vol. 14, no. 3 (May 1957), p. 118. In 1958, the Library published Henry T. Allen, a Register of His Papers in the Library of Congress.

separatedmaterial.head: Transfers
separatedmaterial.p: A portfolio of sketches of Aristide Briand has been transferred to the Prints and Photographs Division where it is identified as part of the Henry T. Allen Papers.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: Copyright in the unpublished writings of Henry T. Allen in these papers and in other collections of papers in the custody of the Library of Congress has been dedicated to the public.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The papers of Henry T. Allen are open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Manuscript Reading Room prior to visiting. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use.

altformavail.head: Microfilm
altformavail.p: A microfilm edition of part of these papers is available on three reels. Consult reference staff in the Manuscript Division concerning availability for purchase or interlibrary loan. To promote preservation of the originals, researchers are required to consult the microfilm edition as available.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Container number, Henry T. Allen Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

chronitem.event: Graduated, United States Military Academy, West Point, N.Y.
Instructor, United States Military Academy, West Point, N.Y.

eventgrp.event: In Santiago Campaign as major and adjutant general
In Philippines as lieutenant colonel, Forty-Third Regiment
Started organization of Philippine Constabulary; was its chief

chronitem.event: Brigadier general and chief of constabulary by act of Congress
Lieutenant colonel, General Staff, in charge of Cavalry Section, War Department
In Mexican Punitive Expedition as lieutenant colonel and colonel

eventgrp.event: Organized cavalry brigade from Thirteenth Cavalry Regiment, Fort Riley, Kans.
Assigned as commander, Ninetieth Division, Camp Travis, Tex.

chronitem.event: Commanded Ninetieth Division at Toul, Saint-Mihiel, Meuse-Argonne, France
Commanded Eighth Army Corps at Montigny-sur-Aube, France

eventgrp.event: Commanded Ninth Army Corps at Nogent-en-Bassigny, France
Commanded Seventh Army Corps at Wittlich, Germany

chronitem.event: Active in organizing veterans' groups for Alfred Emanuel Smith for president; unsuccessful aspirant for Democratic vice-presidential nomination

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p:
The papers of Henry Tureman Allen (1859-1930) span the years 1806-1933, with the bulk of the material dating from 1883 to 1933. The collection relates mainly to Allen's military career as a member of an Alaskan exploring party, 1885-1886; as organizer and chief of the Philippine Constabulary, 1901-1907; as a member of the Mexican Punitive Expedition, 1916-1917; as commander of the Ninetieth Division during the First World War, and as commander of the American Occupation Forces on the Rhine, 1919-1923. Subsequent to his retirement from the army in 1923, he was active in organizing various veterans' groups for the 1928 Democratic presidential candidate, Alfred Emanuel Smith; material relating to this political activity is among the papers. A few Allen family papers are also in the collection. The papers are organized into the following series: Diaries, General Correspondence, Letterbooks, Military Matters, Speech, Article, and Book File, Miscellany,
Photographs, Printed Matter, Clippings, Maps, Reports, Photograph Albums, Scrapbooks and Portfolio, and Oversize.

The bulk of the collection consists of correspondence, personal as well as professional. Included, too, are diaries, manuscripts of a book,
My Rhineland Journal, and numerous speeches and articles, reports of Allen's military activities, photographs, and scrapbooks.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Papers
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in fourteen series:

scopecontent.p: Diaries of Allen and his wife, Dora J. Allen.

arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically, with Dora Allen's diaries filed at the end of Container 1.

scopecontent.p: Letters sent and received including occasional family papers.

altformavail.p: Partially available on negative microfilm. Shelf no. 19,102.

p.emph: Available on negative microfilm. Shelf no. 19,102, reel 1

arrangement.p: Arranged as letters received and letters sent and therein chronologically.

unittitle.unitdate: 1923-1924, American Committee for the Relief of German Children

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, reports, transcripts, general, operations, and field orders, maps and sketches, ordinances, notes, minutes of meetings, speeches and writings, printed matter, and miscellaneous military papers.

p.emph: Available on negative microfilm. Shelf no. 19,102, Reels 2-3

scopecontent.p:
Handwritten and typewritten drafts and printed copies of speeches and articles as well as typescripts of Allen's book
My Rhineland Journal.

arrangement.p: Arranged by type of material and thereunder chronologically.

scopecontent.p: Genealogical and biographical material, financial papers, and military honors.

arrangement.p: Chronological span dates provided, but otherwise unarranged.

scopecontent.p: Photographs of Allen and various persons and scenes in his life.

arrangement.p: Chronological span dates provided, but otherwise unarranged.

scopecontent.p: Maps used for military campaigns and maneuvers.

arrangement.p: Chronological span dates provided, but otherwise unarranged.

scopecontent.p: Reports chiefly on the occupation of Germany after World War I.

did.unittitle: "Notes on Rhineland Commission and IARHC," 1920, Jan.-July
"Ordinances IARHC 1 Jan.-Feb. 1922, Annex to History of American Representation in Occupied Germany 1922-1923"

scopecontent.p: Photographs relating to occupied Germany, Marechal Joffre, and the Philippines.
Correspondence, photographs, clippings, and miscellany. Also includes portfolio of maps, photographs, and drawings at end of file.

arrangement.p: Arranged and described according to the series, containers, and folders from which the items were removed.

did.unittitle: Portfolio of maps, photographs, and drawings (Container 62)
